body.p: Knox County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of George Madison Adams and Amelia White Adams. Nephew of John White, speaker of the United States House of Representatives from 1841 to 1848. Residing in Barbourville, Knox County, in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in 1850. Clerk in Barbourville in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as 1st Lieutenant and Sergeant Major from September 22, 1861 to November 1, 1862. Promoted to Adjutant to regiment on November 1, 1862. Promoted to Major on February 16, 1863. Resigned on August 5, 1863.
